Hi Wayne,

 

With regard to timelines, subject to no issues arising with the VIF applications, our external lawyer estimated the following timelines:

 

*         Annual returns filed by 17th November 2023

*         Liquidation to commence before 30th November 2023

*         The liquidation itself will take approximately 1+ year, this assumes that the directors file all tax returns to date of liquidation within one month of liquidation (we will advise of o/s tax returns once appointed)

 

 

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

*         All revenue filings and liabilities must be filed and paid to date of liquidation

*         A letter of clearance from Revenue Commissioners is required to exit the liquidation

*         The Company Registration Office filings are not filed since FYE 2018. Accordingly, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022 must be filed.

 

 

Best,

Tarek

With regard to timelines, subject to no issues arising with the VIF applications, our external lawyer estimated the following timelines:

 

*         Annual returns filed by 17th November 2023

Subject: RE: Fitra International Limited FY 2022

 

Hi Wayne,

 

With regard to timelines, subject to no issues arising with the VIF applications, our external lawyer estimated the following timelines:

 

*         Annual returns filed by 17th November 2023

*         Liquidation to commence before 30th November 2023

*         The liquidation itself will take approximately 1+ year, this assumes that the directors file all tax returns to date of liquidation within one month of liquidation (we will advise of o/s tax returns once appointed)

 

 

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

*         All revenue filings and liabilities must be filed and paid to date of liquidation

*         A letter of clearance from Revenue Commissioners is required to exit the liquidation

*         The Company Registration Office filings are not filed since FYE 2018. Accordingly, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022 must be filed.

 

 

Best,

Tarek

Hi Wayne,

 

With regard to timelines, subject to no issues arising with the VIF applications, our external lawyer estimated the following timelines:

 

*         Annual returns filed by 17th November 2023

*         Liquidation to commence before 30th November 2023

*         The liquidation itself will take approximately 1+ year, this assumes that the directors file all tax returns to date of liquidation within one month of liquidation (we will advise of o/s tax returns once appointed)

 

 

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

*         All revenue filings and liabilities must be filed and paid to date of liquidation

*         A letter of clearance from Revenue Commissioners is required to exit the liquidation

*         The Company Registration Office filings are not filed since FYE 2018. Accordingly, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022 must be filed.

 

 

Best,

Tarek

	Hi Niall,

	 

	Thanks for the feedback.

	 

	It is definitely being liquidated.

	 

	Unfortunately there is currently a delay in the legal side of things with probate that is stopping the company from being wound up. We therefore have to get FY 2022 filed in in order to be compliant.

	 

	I am happy to go ahead with the fees of EURO 15,000 for the FY 2022 audit.

	 

	 

	On a separate note, just in case there is further delay on the legal side of things, we may be in a situation where we also have to file FY 2023. To save time in the future if we do have to file FY 23 FS, can you also give me a quote for the audit fee for FY 2023.

	 

	For FY 2022, I am attaching the TB as at 31 December 2022 so that you can get the ball rolling from your side.

	 

	Please send me the documentation that you need to be signed for FY 2022 and you will get started on that too.

	 

	Thanks and regards,

	Wayne

Hi Wayne,

 

With regard to timelines, subject to no issues arising with the VIF applications, our external lawyer estimated the following timelines:

 

*         Annual returns filed by 17th November 2023

*         Liquidation to commence before 30th November 2023

*         The liquidation itself will take approximately 1+ year, this assumes that the directors file all tax returns to date of liquidation within one month of liquidation (we will advise of o/s tax returns once appointed)

 

 

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

*         All revenue filings and liabilities must be filed and paid to date of liquidation

*         A letter of clearance from Revenue Commissioners is required to exit the liquidation

*         The Company Registration Office filings are not filed since FYE 2018. Accordingly, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022 must be filed.

 

 

Best,

Tarek

From: Wayne Standish <Wayne.Standish@chalhoub.com <mailto:Wayne.Standish@chalhoub.com> >
	Sent: Tuesday 18 July 2023 13:35
	To: Savage, Niall <niall.savage@kpmg.ie <mailto:niall.savage@kpmg.ie> >
	Cc: Urmi Desai <Urmi.Desai@chalhoub.com <mailto:Urmi.Desai@chalhoub.com> >
	Subject: RE: Fitra International Limited FY 2022

	 

	Hi Niall,

	 

	Thanks for the feedback.

	 

	It is definitely being liquidated.

	 

	Unfortunately there is currently a delay in the legal side of things with probate that is stopping the company from being wound up. We therefore have to get FY 2022 filed in in order to be compliant.

	 

	I am happy to go ahead with the fees of EURO 15,000 for the FY 2022 audit.

	 

	 

	On a separate note, just in case there is further delay on the legal side of things, we may be in a situation where we also have to file FY 2023. To save time in the future if we do have to file FY 23 FS, can you also give me a quote for the audit fee for FY 2023.

	 

	For FY 2022, I am attaching the TB as at 31 December 2022 so that you can get the ball rolling from your side.

	 

	Please send me the documentation that you need to be signed for FY 2022 and you will get started on that too.

	 

	Thanks and regards,

	Wayne

Subject: RE: Fitra International Limited FY 2022

 

Hi Wayne,

 

With regard to timelines, subject to no issues arising with the VIF applications, our external lawyer estimated the following timelines:

 

*         Annual returns filed by 17th November 2023

*         Liquidation to commence before 30th November 2023

*         The liquidation itself will take approximately 1+ year, this assumes that the directors file all tax returns to date of liquidation within one month of liquidation (we will advise of o/s tax returns once appointed)

 

 

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

*         All revenue filings and liabilities must be filed and paid to date of liquidation

*         A letter of clearance from Revenue Commissioners is required to exit the liquidation

*         The Company Registration Office filings are not filed since FYE 2018. Accordingly, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022 must be filed.

 

 

Best,

Tarek

Hi Wayne,

 

With regard to timelines, subject to no issues arising with the VIF applications, our external lawyer estimated the following timelines:

 

*         Annual returns filed by 17th November 2023

*         Liquidation to commence before 30th November 2023

*         The liquidation itself will take approximately 1+ year, this assumes that the directors file all tax returns to date of liquidation within one month of liquidation (we will advise of o/s tax returns once appointed)

 

 

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

*         All revenue filings and liabilities must be filed and paid to date of liquidation

*         A letter of clearance from Revenue Commissioners is required to exit the liquidation

*         The Company Registration Office filings are not filed since FYE 2018. Accordingly, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022 must be filed.

 

 

Best,

Tarek

Hi Wayne,

 

With regard to timelines, subject to no issues arising with the VIF applications, our external lawyer estimated the following timelines:

 

*         Annual returns filed by 17th November 2023

*         Liquidation to commence before 30th November 2023

*         The liquidation itself will take approximately 1+ year, this assumes that the directors file all tax returns to date of liquidation within one month of liquidation (we will advise of o/s tax returns once appointed)

 

 

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

*         All revenue filings and liabilities must be filed and paid to date of liquidation

*         A letter of clearance from Revenue Commissioners is required to exit the liquidation

*         The Company Registration Office filings are not filed since FYE 2018. Accordingly, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022 must be filed.

Hi Wayne,

 

With regard to timelines, subject to no issues arising with the VIF applications, our external lawyer estimated the following timelines:

 

*         Annual returns filed by 17th November 2023

*         Liquidation to commence before 30th November 2023

*         The liquidation itself will take approximately 1+ year, this assumes that the directors file all tax returns to date of liquidation within one month of liquidation (we will advise of o/s tax returns once appointed)

 

 

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

*         All revenue filings and liabilities must be filed and paid to date of liquidation

*         A letter of clearance from Revenue Commissioners is required to exit the liquidation

*         The Company Registration Office filings are not filed since FYE 2018. Accordingly, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022 must be filed.

	Hi Niall,

	 

	Thanks for the feedback.

	 

	It is definitely being liquidated.

	 

	Unfortunately there is currently a delay in the legal side of things with probate that is stopping the company from being wound up. We therefore have to get FY 2022 filed in in order to be compliant.

	 

	I am happy to go ahead with the fees of EURO 15,000 for the FY 2022 audit.

	 

	 

	On a separate note, just in case there is further delay on the legal side of things, we may be in a situation where we also have to file FY 2023. To save time in the future if we do have to file FY 23 FS, can you also give me a quote for the audit fee for FY 2023.

	 

	For FY 2022, I am attaching the TB as at 31 December 2022 so that you can get the ball rolling from your side.

	 

	Please send me the documentation that you need to be signed for FY 2022 and you will get started on that too.

	 

	Thanks and regards,

	Wayne

Hi Wayne,

 

With regard to timelines, subject to no issues arising with the VIF applications, our external lawyer estimated the following timelines:

 

*         Annual returns filed by 17th November 2023

*         Liquidation to commence before 30th November 2023

*         The liquidation itself will take approximately 1+ year, this assumes that the directors file all tax returns to date of liquidation within one month of liquidation (we will advise of o/s tax returns once appointed)

 

 

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

Moreover, the liquidation procedure itself is as follows:

 

The 2 options for liquidating the company are:

 

*         Requires 75% shareholder votes

*         Directors are required to execute E1 Declaration of Solvency.

*         All revenue filings and liabilities must be filed and paid to date of liquidation

*         A letter of clearance from Revenue Commissioners is required to exit the liquidation

*         The Company Registration Office filings are not filed since FYE 2018. Accordingly, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022 must be filed.

 

 

Best,

Tarek
